links.title: Do you really know what your kid's doing on that smartphone?
links.description: Ewelina Cudzich, 13, checks her phone in her Chicago home, Friday, June 8, 2018. Cudzich, who starts high school this fall, says she understands that parents would want to monitor a phone sometimes but thinks teens should be given more freedom as they prove they can be responsible.

links.title: 2018 iPhones might snub Samsung for LG screens, and you can download iOS 12 beta
links.description: Once again, Apple and Samsung make headlines with their constant patent battle -- is it finally, finally over? Even if the two mobile heavyweights have finally made amends, some of Apple's 2018 iPhones might replace their original Samsung screens with LG ones.

$AAPL $NVDA $WB China Factory Gauge Slips in June as Trade War Dampens Outlook https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-06-30/china-factory-gauge-slips-in-june-as-credit-squeeze-hits-output

links.title: China Factory Gauge Slips in June as Trade War Dampens Outlook
links.description: China's official factory gauge fell more than expected in June, just as the world's two biggest economies head toward a trade war. The manufacturing purchasing managers index stood at 51.5 in June, versus 51.9 in May, and the forecast of 51.6 in a Bloomberg survey of economists.

messages.body: $AAPL $NVDA $WB North Korea Steps Up Production of Uranium Fuel, NBC Reports https://www.bloomberg.com/politics/articles/2018-06-30/north-korea-steps-up-production-of-uranium-fuel-nbc-reports

links.title: North Korea Steps Up Production of Uranium Fuel, NBC Reports
links.description: U.S. intelligence agencies believe that North Korea has increased its production of fuel for nuclear weapons at multiple secret sites in recent months, NBC reported, citing unidentified American officials. The NBC report quoted U.S. officials who said they believe that North Korean leader Kim Jong Un may try to hide those facilities as he seeks more concessions in nuclear talks with the Trump administration.
